content.description: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe is there. Bonnie is telling them of her sex-capades.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on that hard cider, and then suddenly, I don’t know, we were, we were making out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tell it again. (pause, we see Rachel is not amused.) Seriously.
[cut to Rachel and Monica at the counter.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else but sex?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure. Well y’know, earlier she was talking about geography.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, she was listing the countries she’s done it in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I think we all learned something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you guys! Look what I found! Look at this! (She hands Chandler a picture) That’s my Mom’s writing! Look.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me and Frank and Phoebe, Graduation 1965.
content.parenthetical: reading the back of the picture

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what that means?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That you’re actually 50?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, that’s not, that’s not me Phoebe, that’s her pal Phoebe. According to her high school yearbook, they were like B.F.F. (Ross and Bonnie look at her quizzically) Best Friends Forever.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is so cool.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories about my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and she lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, we can!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Shoot! I can’t go, I have to work!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s too bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, big, fat bummerrr.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So great! Okay! Tomorrow we’re gonna drive out to Montauk.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Bonnie had sex there!
(Rachel turns and gives him a look, and Joey quickly apologises.)

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are waiting for Phoebe to arrive with the cab.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you look at them. Am I ever gonna find a boyfriend again? I gonna die an old maid.
content.parenthetical: watching a happy couple walk by, arm in arm

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not gonna die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I’ll be your boyfriend.
(At that suggestion Monica starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why is that so funny?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You made a joke right? So I laughed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, no. You’re Chandler. Y’know, Chandler! (hits him on the arm)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so we’ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically y’know, I mean say we weren’t friends, say it’s a blind date. I show up at your door, and I’m like (in a fake voice) “Hey, nice to meet, ya. Hey, oh-hey.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I’d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: walking up carrying a brown paper bag

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s just my luggage.
(Phoebe drives up.)

content.speaker: Chandler, Monica, and Joey
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I am having the best karma this week. First, I find this woman who knew my parents, and then my client with the fuzzy back gives me his beach house.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I wasn’t talking about his karma.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, check out the hat!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a minute, I know that hat! I was taken aboard that hat! They did experiments on me! I can’t have children!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Seriously, where did you get the hat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross gave it to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I think she looks good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Buy it for ya, or win it for ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that hats are back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And this time, they’ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.

content.description: At the Beach, it’s raining cats and dogs as the gang arrives. Chandler and Monica are taking shelter under Rachel’s hat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Go, go, go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!
(They get inside and notice on small problem.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oy!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s with all this sand? (picking a handful of sand off of the floor, which is covered in sand)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.

content.description: Phoebe Sr. house, she is a real estate agent and is trying to sell a house over the phone. By the way, it’s still raining outside.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Well, yes, it’s kind’ve an unusual house. It has umm, three beautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But y’know, the ocean is right there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Knock, knock, knock.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Ah, oh, hang on a second. (to Phoebe) Come in, come in. (on phone) All right, so think about it, and call me back. (hangs up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Ahh, yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Phoebe Abott, I’m your best friends daughter!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: You’re Erwin’s daughter?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here. (hands her the picture) Lily, from high school. Remember?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I… Then you must be?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Phoebe. (points to her) Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She named me after you I guess.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There’s Frank. (points to the picture.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That’s my Dad, that’s Frank! Yeah! I’m sorry I’m getting all flingy.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Take it easy—if you want, there’s cookies on the counter, or, or—sangria! (jumps up) I can make sangria!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I’ve been, I’ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Oh no, I-I’m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after high school.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents. Everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Ohh, well. Y’know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname for the three of us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, what? What was it?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: The three losers. Oh, poor Lily. (Phoebe notices a picture on the fridge, takes it, and puts it in her pocket.) Ohh, y’know I-I heard about what happened, that must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, no, it was great.

content.description: The beach house, it’s still raining. Chandler is building a sand castle, Rachel is doing Monica’s nails, and they’re all drinking margaritas, obviously bored.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know what a really good rainy day game is?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No, no!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you crazy?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it’s like a law!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Allll done!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, who’s next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she comes to Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a “Please?” look.) No way!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, please?! I’m boredddd! You let me do it once before.
(Ross shoots Joey a look, who shoots Chandler a look, who gives Joey an “Oh my God.” look back.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah well, if ah, if that’s the rule this weekend… (She gets up) No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get away!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just once!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Stay away!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Take it like a man, Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! (in his escape attempt he crushes Chandler’s sand castle) No!
content.parenthetical: he gets up and starts to run away from her

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Big bullies!!
(Ross dives over the couch, Rachel goes the other way, and lands up top of him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!
(They get into a wrestling match, that ends with Ross making Rachel paint her forehead with the nail polish. They both end up lying next to each other, stop, and look at each other for a moment.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, so, how are we doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bored and bored!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Noo!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what’s Phoebe like?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m kind, caring, and sweet. What’s Monica like?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh well, where is he?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn’t heard from him on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica)! Isn’t this what he would look like now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, why would she lie to you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, but we’re having dinner tomorrow night, so I figured, she’s gonna tell me then. Y’know maybe she just wanted to give him time to, buy me presents, I don’t know! So, you’re all bored?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I’m gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you, whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, all right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fan out! Fan out!
(They do so, and Phoebe gets in the middle, closes her eyes, and starts spinning in a circle.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y’know we could just do this. (She stops at Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OH YES!!!!!
[cut to later]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Strip Happy Days Game?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well, I couldn’t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip Bag Of Old Knitting Stuff.
(Monica rolls, and Ross goes first.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, (reading the card) Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool points. Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off one item of clothing. It hasn’t happened yet, but we’re all very excited.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, come on! (blows on the dice) Daddy needs a new pair of electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department! (They all look at him, and he shuts up and rolls the dice.) (he moves his piece) Okay. (reading a card) Take Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me five, and let’s see who is gonna lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribianni.

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: Woo-hooooo!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, relax. It’s just a shoe.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Wooooo!!!!
[cut to later in the game]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, your band is playing at Arnold’s, collect three cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey’s boxers!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, take ‘em off!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Actually, y’know it’s kinda cold, so how about I keep my boxers on, and give you all a peek at the good stuff?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I’m gonna make more margaritas! (She pours the rest of the pitcher into Ross’s glass.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just making margaritas.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think I’ll help her out. (She gets up to go over and help Rachel, and reveals she has no pants.) (to Rachel) What is going on here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You painting his toenails?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chasing him all around the room?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s totally flirting with you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He is, isn’t he? I don’t know, I don’t know, I mean maybe it’s just being here at the beach together or, I don’t know. But it’s like something… (she’s interrupted by the sound of Bonnie entering)

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! (Rachel is shocked) Hi Bonnie!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: What are you guys doing?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’re playing Strip Happy Days Game!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Cool! I’ll catch up! (She takes off her sweater.)

content.description: The beach house, the next morning. Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you still don’t think I’m boyfriend material?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I saw you checking me out during the game last night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t even take off your pants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, lucky for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well! Is everybody else having just the best time?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhh! Shhhh! Joey’s asleep.
(Joey is sleeping on the floor and is buried in sand that has been carved into a mermaid complete with breasts.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn’t up yet. Did you guys hear them last night?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, I don’t know what they were doing, but at one point sea turtles actually came up to the house.
(Ross and Bonnie enter)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good morning.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey! How did everybody sleep?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Like a log.

content.speaker: Ross and Bonnie
content.text: Us too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m going for a walk.
(Joey finally wakes up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.
(Joey looks down and his look turns from shock to satisfaction.)

content.description: The porch, Bonnie is coming back from swimming, Rachel is reading.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey, what happened to you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, ah nothin’. I just felt like hangin’ out here and reading.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Oh, the water was sooo great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh, sorry I missed that.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh-ha-ha!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much easier when I used to shave my head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I gotta tell ya, I just loved your look when you were bald.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean you definitely should do that.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Y’know what, I should do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are soo cool.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: All right.
(As Bonnie goes to do just that, Rachel smiles to herself, proud of what she’s done.)

content.description: The beach house, at night. Phoebe is hangs up the phone, and gently pushes one of the stools over.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the matter, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She’s avoiding me, she doesn’t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won’t tell me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aww Pheebs, that sucks!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, don’t “Aww Pheebs, that sucks!” me yet. (she starts to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where ya going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, she’s out of town so, there’s gotta be something in her house that tells me where my Father is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, are any of those people here?!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, no!! No, no!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I’ll-I’ll fill her ice trays.
(She exits just as Bonnie comes down the stairs, as bald as Michael Jordan.)

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey, everybody!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Wow!! (they all recoil in shock and horror)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh-haa-haa! Look what ‘cha did! (Rachel has her hand over her mouth to keep from laughing.)

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: You wanna touch it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nooo, but it, but it’s great.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Come on, touch it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (He gently touches it.) You can feel all the bones in your skull.

content.description: Outside the beach house, Ross is coming out to talk to Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she happened to bring up y’know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who was it? Oh, that’s right, that’s right, it was you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She said you gave her the razor!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, no, I’m good.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you in a bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, have fun! Wooo!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on see, she doesn’t look that bad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you thinking?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right! Ross, do you think it’s easy for me to see you with somebody else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You still love me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You still love me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get back together?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! Maybe! I, I don’t know. Ross, I still can’t forgive you for what you did, I can’t, I just, but sometimes when I’m with you I just, I feel so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just, I feel, I-I just…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I feel…
(Ross leans in and kisses her. They both look at each other for a moment, and then embrace in a more passionate kiss, only to be interrupted by Joey and Chandler coming outside.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo!! I don’t care! I’m not, I’m not gonna playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!
(Rachel and Ross both stop kissing, and quickly step back from each other.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I made cards!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well! Good night. (to Ross) I’m going upstairs.

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: G’night.
(Rachel walks inside, stops, and turns back to look at Ross for a moment then goes upstairs.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wanna play strip poker for practice?

content.description: Phoebe Sr.’s house, Phoebe is breaking in through a window.

content.text: (She throws her bag inside, and starts to climb through the window. She gets halfway in and the window slams shut on her butt.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the window slams shut.) Oh, shhh!

(She starts walking across the darkened room and hits her head on a wind chime hanging from the ceiling, to stop it from making a noise she grabs it and “Shhh’s” it. She goes into the kitchen and finds Phoebe Sr.’s appointment book, to read it she opens the freezer. Just as she starts to read, Phoebe Sr. jumps out from her bedroom with a coat hanger, startling Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No!! It’s me! It’s me! I-I didn’t want to make any noise!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Then don’t break in!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: What are you doing here?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay, because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you’re just mean! (pause) So, just tell me the truth!

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My Father is Chuck Magioni?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: No, no, that’s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last year! And I’m very sorry, but I don’t know where your Father is, and that’s the truth.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: But umm, you’re right. I think that a person should know where they come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I’m your mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Heh?

content.speaker: Phoebe Sr
content.text: Y’know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all floopy, and…
(At that Phoebe’s eyes open in shock.)

content.description: Outside the beach house, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler what happened with Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not true! Her, she doesn’t even know what she wants! Rachel’s still mad about the whole thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don’t need that kind’ve hurt. Take it from a guy who’s never had a long term relationship…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: You guys, the water’s great. You should really go in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Okay, well g’night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good night.

content.speaker: Bonnie
content.text: Don’t be too long.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okey-dokey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There is not one hair on that head.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, it’ll grow back, right? And she-she’s really fun, and she’s cool, and-and I’m finally moving on. Y’know? I mean getting over Rachel was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y’know? Y’know, and I’m finally feeling sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her, and-and-and it doesn’t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you’re doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie’s free tonight?

content.description: The hallway between the bedrooms. Ross is coming upstairs and stops between two doors. He looks at the one on the right, then he looks at the one on his left, thinks about it, and goes in the one on his right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. (closes the door)

content.description: The beach house, Chandler is simulating he’s coming to pick up Monica for a date. Chandler knocks on the door, and Monica answers it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s that weird voice again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you’re gonna wanna date this next guy, I swear!
(Monica closes the door, Chandler knocks, and Monica opens it to reveal Chandler on his knees.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! I’m Dorf! You’re date for the evening. (Monica walks away in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that’s good stuff!!
